GLITZ.Definition: the quality of appearing very impressive and attractive

SHOW BUSINESS.Definition: the entertainment industry of film, theatre, and television

FLICKERING.Definition: appearing for a very short time before disappearing again

CRACKLING.Definition: characterised by much activity or excitement

ON THE BRINK OF.Definition: at the point when it was about to happen

PATENTS.Definition: permissions or licences that allowed him to use his inventions exclusively for a period of time

KINETOSCOPE.Definition: a type of machine people could use to watch movies

LITIGIOUS.Definition: too ready to take arguments to a court of law

QUINTESSENTIALLY.Definition: in a way that it was the most perfect and typical example of its kind

STRADDLED.Definition: stood with one leg on either side of

RUGGED.Definition: wild, not easy to travel over

CULMINATING.Definition: reaching the highest point of action

GUNSLINGING.Definition: carrying guns and ready to use them

CHARISMA.Definition: the quality of having an attractive or charming personality

EMULATE.Definition: act like them, copy their behaviour

SOCIALITES.Definition: famous people who liked to take part in social activities and entertainment

INITIALS.Definition: the starting letters of their names

ROARING.Definition: making a loud deep extended sound or cry

PEAK.Definition: the point of its highest achievement

WIDESPREAD.Definition: used by a lot of producers

PROPAGANDA.Definition: images, information and ideas used to influence or affect people's opinions

AFFLUENCE.Definition: the state of having a lot of money

DEMOGRAPHIC.Definition: a particular part or group of the population

DIVERSIFICATION.Definition: the action of including more different types

YODELLING.Definition: a form of singing which involves repeated and quick changes in the voice

IN THE THROES OF.Definition: in the middle of (a very difficult situation)

COUNTERCULTURE.Definition: a way of life and set of ideas that are different from the established or accepted standards

GROSSING.Definition: earning or producing a lot of money

THE LOWEST COMMON DENOMINATOR.Definition: that would accept low-quality products and entertainment

FORMULAIC.Definition: not original, used many times before

PRECEDENCE.Definition: the condition of being considered more important than

IN A BID TO.Definition: in an attempt to, trying to

HIGHEST-GROSSING.Definition: producing the highest amount of money

RECESSION.Definition: a period when the conditions for the economy and the businesses were bad

TIDAL WAVE.Definition: an extremely large wave often caused by an earthquake (used here to show that it was a very great success)

ROLL-OUT.Definition: the fact that they were made available for the first time

PROGNOSIS.Definition: a forecast or prediction of the likely outcome

EAGER.Definition: wanting very much to do it
